title: Red Hair Dominated at Coachella - Consider This Your Sign to Jump Aboard
description: Another Coachella season is officially underway, and from it, we've had no shortage of fresh and inspiring beauty looks to take in. For starters, we saw Blackpink's Lisa's dramatic hair transformation to "mushroom" blond ahead of her first Coachella solo performance. The queen of the "clean-girl aesthetic," Hailey Bieber, also had some fun with her nail art as she rocked hot pink "lava nails" that matched her outfit. But aside from those looks, we saw another trend emerge amongst the celebrities in attendance this year: every shade of red hair under the sun. The desert sun might have reached triple-digit temperatures over the weekend, but it still didn't compare to these hot, fiery looks. Megan Thee Stallion, Emma Roberts, Bea Miller, and Heeseung all jumped on the trend with their own unique twist. "Copper cowgirl," "cherry-cola," and "calico" are just a few of the variations we spotted. If you're considering going red for the first time, it's best to seek some help from a salon professional to ensure your big change leaves you feeling your best. In the meantime, let these celebrity red hair looks at Coachella inspire you. We recommend saving them as inspiration the next time you're itching for something new.
author: Brittany Leitner
excerpt: Every shade of red hair under the sun was trending at Coachella 2025 this year. From cowboy copper to cherry-cola red on Megan Thee Stallion and more.

Another Coachella season is officially underway, and from it, we've had no shortage of fresh and inspiring beauty looks to take in. For starters, we saw Blackpink's Lisa's dramatic hair transformation to "mushroom" blond ahead of her first Coachella solo performance. The queen of the "clean-girl aesthetic," Hailey Bieber, also had some fun with her nail art as she rocked hot pink "lava nails" that matched her outfit. But aside from those looks, we saw another trend emerge amongst the celebrities in attendance this year: every shade of red hair under the sun.

The desert sun might have reached triple-digit temperatures over the weekend, but it still didn't compare to these hot, fiery looks. Megan Thee Stallion, Emma Roberts, Bea Miller, and Heeseung all jumped on the trend with their own unique twist. "Copper cowgirl," "cherry-cola," and "calico" are just a few of the variations we spotted.

If you're considering going red for the first time, it's best to seek some help from a salon professional to ensure your big change leaves you feeling your best. In the meantime, let these celebrity red hair looks at Coachella inspire you. We recommend saving them as inspiration the next time you're itching for something new.

Emma Robertâ€™s Red Hair

Emma Roberts' hair is the epitome of cowgirl copper, proving that this trend is pushing on in 2025. Roberts visits Los Angeles salon Nine Zero One for all of her dye jobs and often alternates between brunette, blond, and red hues. We have to say, this red is definitely a favorite on the "American Horror Story" actress.

Megan Thee Stallion's Red Hair

For someone as effortlessly cool as Megan Thee Stallion, she can do no wrong when it comes to bold beauty trends. Proof? This bright, cherry-cola red shade lit up under the Coachella stage lights and was definitely one for the books. Megan even brought out rap legend Queen Latifah for her set. Iconic.

Bea Miller's Red Hair Color

Bea Miller has been on the music scene since 2015, when she released her debut album, "Not An Apology." This year, Zedd brought Miller out on stage during his day-three set. Miller rocked two-tone hair, almost reminiscent of the "calico" color trend. The red and orange color feels very on-brand for Coachella.

Heeseung of ENHYPEN's Red Hair Color

K-pop star Heeseung of the boy band ENHYPEN showed off his firetruck-red hair color on day two of Coachella. Some people say hair makes the outfit, and that's the case with Heeseung's bright hue and all-denim attire.

Brittany Leitner (she/her) is a New York-based contributing beauty writer at PS. She has over 10 years of experience working in beauty, health, wellness, travel, and celebrity news. Brittany holds a degree in magazine journalism from Syracuse University and previously held editorial positions at Elite Daily and "The Dr. Oz Show" before working as a freelance journalist for the past three years.
